programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Steve McAndrew brings his dying father to London so he can spend his final days in a nearby hospice, but how much time he can spend with his parent is anyone's guess - the Ucos team is hard at work investigating the cold case murder of 55-year-old interpreter Agnes Bradley. A DNA sample provides a link to a rebellious teenager, and the team wonders if the killer could be related to him. But a whole new can of worms is opened when investigators discover the lad's mother was raped - could the same person have killed Agnes? Gerry and Steve hope that interviewing her friends from a local chess club may shed new light on the matter, but it's a possible professional issue that could hold the key to unlocking the mystery. Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Lady Jane makes a spectacular reappearance in Lovejoy's life just as he decides it is time to settle down - leaving him forced to choose between her and Charlotte. Last ever episode of the comedy drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton, Caroline Langrishe, Phyllis Logan and Chris Jury

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An elderly amateur sleuth who was a friend of Danny's is murdered, and he ends up embroiled in the case when his photo is found at the scene. However, the cold case copper becomes convinced that the secret to uncovering her real killer lies within the last case she was working on. Picking up where she left off, he travels to the village of Minchampton, where a woman was said to have been murdered by a local lad 25 years previously. Meanwhile, Sasha is left to cope with the investigating officer on the modern-day Miss Marple's murder - an overbearing contemporary from her Hendon training, by the name of DCI Grace Mackie - and Steve lets Gerry stay with him when he is evicted, but soon comes to regret the act of kindness

Starring James Bolam and Michael French

programme.desc: A chauffeur is found dead in a stretch limousine, stabbed in the neck with a broken champagne bottle. Drama, starring Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Businessman Daniel Boden is found stabbed to death at the wheel of his Land Rover, and Dangerous discovers he was caught up in a lucrative insurance fraud set up by a secret gentleman's club. There are no forensic clues in the vehicle, so the only lead is a phone number Boden called shortly before he died. Peter Davison stars

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe is assigned to nail the crook responsible for a spate of burglaries and links the crimes to a notorious poultry millionaire, but has no evidence to back up his suspicions. Light-hearted drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe reluctantly attends a boring police management seminar, while business is booming back at the restaurant - although Margaret learns that success has its price. Drama, with Richard Griffiths, Malcolm Sinclair, Maggie Steed and Bella Enahoro

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe investigates a crooked takeaway whose staff he suspects of cooking up a burglary, but as he delves deeper into the case he finds an altogether more sinister operation. Crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed, Samantha Janus and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The detective is called out when a body is found on a rubbish pile under the Tyne Bridge. It initially looks like suicide, but evidence reveals the victim was dead before he landed. The search begins to uncover his identity, with just a pawnbroker's receipt, a note with a phone number for one Gwendolyn Howard and a betting slip in the deceased's pocket. Crime drama, guest starring Jim Moir (aka Vic Reeves)

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Disaster strikes when Mike's favourite country musician Holly Collins is found electrocuted in what appears to be a drunken accident or possibly suicide. However, Mike finds a note scrawled in lipstick and begins to investigate the dysfunctional band members - Slim Fingers, Waylon Strings and Jesse James. Detective drama, starring Neill Rea

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. An unusual advertisement appears in Chipping Cleghorn's local gazette, purporting to reveal details of a forthcoming murder, including the date, time and venue. It appears to be a morbid practical joke, but proves shockingly accurate. Puzzled by the mystery, and with more suspects than he can shake a stick at, Inspector Craddock quickly enlists Miss Marple's help in solving the crime. Joan Hickson stars

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: A past case returns to haunt Rebus when he is called to a local landmark, where the remains of a prostitute have been found. The inspector is convinced a member of the Scottish Parliament is responsible - but his efforts to secure a conviction are hampered by the arrival of a high-flying colleague drafted in by his superior. Crime drama, starring Ken Stott

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim Carver is in a quandary after turning down Marie's proposal of marriage - could the imminent return of his old flame June Ackland have anything to do with his decision? Luckily, dizzy PC Honey Harman is on hand with her astrology book to give the confused copper a spot of romantic advice. Meanwhile, Danny Glaze finds himself in a terrifying situation as he hunts for missing teenager Nathan - the brother of gun-toting local rogue Prince - and Des Taviner interviews a witness who seems more interested in speaking to the scouse PC's superior, Sgt Sheelagh Murphy

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gemma Osbourne's loyalties are divided when she and Kerry Young are called to a dispute at a refuge where immigration officials are trying to extract a woman and child facing deportation. Eva Sharpe returns to work, but Phil Hunter doubts whether she's still up to the job as they investigate an alleged assault at a slick law firm, and June Ackland spies a wedding ring in Jim Carver's desk drawer _ is this going to be her lucky day?

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gemma Osbourne shows everyone her nasty side as she continues her stand against the immigration officials, prompting Superintendent Okaro to doubt her suitability as an officer _ and leading to a confrontation between the aggrieved PC and her no-nonsense superior Gina Gold. Eva Sharpe continues her investigation into the law-firm assault _ even when the alleged victim drops the charges _ while on the personal front, June Ackland struggles to hide her loneliness as Jim and Marie celebrate their engagement _ until an equally lovelorn colleague steps into the breach

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: It's the morning after the night before for June Ackland and Tony Stamp, who are tiptoeing around each other following their liaison _ could this be the start of a new station romance? Debbie McAllister investigates an attempted sexual assault by a taxi driver, and soon finds a likely culprit. The problem is, the man in question is Sheelagh Murphy's husband _ meaning someone has to tell the sergeant that she might be married to a rapist

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Luke Ashton is put out when old enemy Dale Smith returns to Sun Hill complete with sergeant's stripes. Superintendent Adam Okaro has serious doubts about whether Patrick Murphy is really the man behind the taxi assaults. June Ackland is hurt when she doesn't receive an invitation to Jim and Marie's wedding, prompting lovesick Tony Stamp to make a chivalrous gesture

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Miss Matty confides in Mary about Mr Holbrook's death, prompting her to inform Major Gordon of Jessie's regret over not marrying him. Dr Harrison tells Rev Hutton of his intentions toward Sophy and asks permission to court her, blissfully unaware that the generosity he has shown to Mrs Rose has accidentally created an unlikely love triangle. Penultimate episode of the costume drama, starring Judi Dench and Simon Woods

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The true nature of friendship within Cranford is revealed as the ladies rally to help Miss Matty when she receives terrible news. Meanwhile, Dr Harrison suffers as his career, reputation and relationship all seem ruined, while Miss Galindo and Mr Carter grow closer as they face up to the tragedy of Hanbury. Judi Dench, Philip Glenister and Simon Woods star

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Period drama about a 19-year-old woman, who is attacked after an engagement party in honour of a farmer for whom she has feelings. Carli Norris stars

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Following the destruction of their home by the McGraths, Tilly and her grandmother are forced to live a life of solitude. Period drama, starring Carli Norris

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface investigates a locked room mystery when supermodel 'Birdie' returns to Great Slaughter

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Feature-length Christmas special from 2001. A veteran actress is shot through the heart during the filming of a darkly surreal love story, but the bullet appears to have passed through a plate-glass window without breaking it. With Maddy out of the country, Jonathan is lumbered with a pushy theatrical agent who has a nose for mystery. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies, Julia Sawalha, Steven Berkoff, Mary Tamm and Jay Benedict

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part one of two. DI Joseph Chandler and DS Ray Miles investigate the deaths of four people who were slaughtered at a tailor's fortified workshop, a gruesome and seemingly impossible crime that has left London's East End gripped with fear. Edward Buchan joins the detectives once again, hoping his historical expertise will help them solve the grisly case. Thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. The case takes on an almost supernatural edge when a second mass murder occurs, with no obvious signs of a break-in, no escape route and no forensics left at the scene. Chandler, Miles and the team unearth more about the infamous Ratcliffe Highway murders of 1811, hoping to avoid making the same mistakes and solve the case before further lives are lost. Crime thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The promise of romance is put on hold when news of another murder interrupts Luther's date with Mary. Determined to predict the copycat fetishist's next move, he throws himself into a pile of cold case files and after his public disagreement with Ripley, he orders the sergeant to investigate the killing of Jared Cass on his own. Meanwhile, a care-home cancer patient receives a chilling gift from a visitor, and three girls look forward to a night in - unaware of the danger lurking in their home. Crime drama, starring Idris Elba, Warren Brown and Ned Dennehy

programme.title: Gracie!
programme.desc: Jane Horrocks stars as Gracie Fields in this drama about the singer and comedienne from Rochdale, who in the 1930s became the nation's darling and the highest-paid film actress in the world. Gracie's wartime struggle between love and duty and the repercussions of her relationship with Italian-born Hollywood director Monty Banks are explored. With Tom Hollander

programme.title: Gentleman Jack
programme.desc: A widowed vicar arrives in Halifax with the intention of claiming Ann Walker's hand in marriage - and Eliza Priestley resolves to help him succeed in his objective. Anne sets out to prevent the clergyman causing any trouble, but discovers further threats to her relationship in the shape of Ann's personal demons and interfering family. Work continues apace on the transformation of the Lister estate, and a grisly discovery in the pig sty gives Mary Sowden reason to believe that Thomas is lying about exactly how his father disappeared

programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Oswestry Showground in Shropshire, where Kate Bliss and Ben Cooper are helping today's reds and blues. Natasha also talks to Ben about his family background in Birmingham's Jewellery Quarter

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages three items from a recycling centre in Witley, then she and two experts transform a dressing table, a vintage suitcase and a petite sofa

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers bid against each other to buy a toy rocket and rabbit, a gramophone, lamp shades, a high chair and a brooch

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: The beautiful Wye Valley may not be too far from Bristol, where today's couple are from, but it's a whole world away in terms of lifestyle. Steve Brown has some tempting properties up his sleeve and during some downtime all three manage to unwind and enjoy the scenery with a leisurely canoe ride on the River Wye itself

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Ben and Ruth call on the services of Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill to redesign their garden in Stockport, Greater Manchester, into something more chic. At present it's a bit dated with too much concrete - and too many level changes for it to be safe for their baby daughter Eve. The couple are imagining a wild, natural garden with prairie style planting and some opportunities for growing their own vegetables. They have a budget of 2,500 available to realise their dreams

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes host a celebrity special of the music quiz, which sees Oti Mabuse and Catherine Tyldesley, Joe Marler and Maisie Adam, and Chris McCausland and John Thomson trying to guess the songs from their intros. Which pair will make it through to the final and get the chance to win up to 10,000 for their chosen charity?

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night gameshow, in which contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. In each episode, contestants are guided by a host of celebrity experts, with tonight's advice coming from Ed Balls, Clara Amfo, Ally McCoist, Sindhu Vee, Dan Walker, Stacey Dooley and John Whaite

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the quiz show. Catherine Bohart, Charlie Higson, Lindsey Russell, Neil Jones, Kellie Shirley, Danny John-Jules, Sukh Ojla and Vikki Stone try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max takes Jodie to task for turning up to work with a hangover. When he realises that it is the anniversary of her mother's death, he tries to make amends for making a traumatic day even worse. Gethin rejects Jan's offers of help, and Jacob has arranged to see a therapist but cannot bring himself to go through with it

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: The team are called in when writer Cara Gibson is found dead under a bridge. Her books ruined careers and left a lot of lives in tatters, but could any of her subjects be driven to murder? Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: A Star Is Born (2018)
programme.desc: Following a gig, fading music star Jackson Maine happens upon Ally, a nightclub singer-songwriter. Their instant chemistry leads to a tempestuous romance as he helps her on the road to stardom. However, Jackson's alcoholism has explosive repercussions as her career blossoms. Oscar-winning drama, starring Lady Gaga, Bradley Cooper, who also directed, and Sam Elliott

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Politics London
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from the region

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore a three-bedroom semi in Kidsgrove, Stoke-on-Trent, a split-level maisonette in Brixton, and a detached house in Leicester

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and David Harper are in Nottinghamshire to help two teams look for items at the Newark Antiques Fair. Presenter Charlie Ross also finds out about an everyday object most people take for granted.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Katherine Jenkins visits Syon House in West London to discover its rich Christian history and to share her most memorable moments on Songs of Praise

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple returning from living in Sweden for 25 years who want to find a home in Wiltshire, and goes for a ride with a professional carriage driver

programme.title: Paddington 2 (2017)
programme.desc: The lovable little bear has settled into his new life with the Brown family in London, becoming a much-loved member of the local community - until his search for a birthday present for his aunt leads to him being framed as a thief. While the Browns try to clear Paddington's name, he tries to make himself at home in prison, winning over the other convicts and getting involved in an escape attempt. Comedy adventure, starring Hugh Bonneville, Hugh Grant and Sally Hawkins, with Ben Whishaw providing the voice of Paddington

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin visits the Argyll Coast and Islands, which was designated Hope Spot status in 2019 because it is home to the only nursery in the world for the endangered flapper skate. He joins marine biologist Chris Rickard as he conducts research into these mysterious creatures of the deep. Adam Henson looks at the robots and artificial intelligence being developed that promise to revolutionise UK agriculture. And John Craven launches this year's photo competition in aid of Children in Need

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture displays of emotion from sea creatures, including dolphins getting an adrenaline rush from jumping, leaping and playing tricks in the waves. Spy cameras also capture displays of affection among manatees and cuttlefish courtship, as well as the mimic octopus passing itself off as other creatures to avoid predators

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second show this year from the Eden Project in Cornwall, where items include fragments of hair from the poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge, a set of beads given as a gift from a Zulu king to the Royal Navy surgeon who treated him and a Greek plate dating back to 300BC. Also, Marc Smith hears the stirring story of the Second World War pilot who shot down five enemy aircraft in a single night

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Terry is forced to confide in Arty and Ron over a business venture, while Annie ignores her marital problems by accepting an invitation from Nick. Back at the hostel, Stevie convinces Pattie to spend the day with him and Kate leaves her hut behind in pursuit of a suburban address. With everyone preoccupied, Peter gets forgotten

programme.title: Rush (2013)
programme.desc: The 1976 Formula One Championship season is dominated by a fierce rivalry between two contrasting racers, as daredevil British driver James Hunt and methodical Austrian defending champion Niki Lauda put their lives on the line to outdo each other on the track. Fact-based drama, starring Chris Hemsworth, Daniel Bruhl and Olivia Wilde

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Donna and Dan's garden is small and messy with lots of sharp difficult surfaces that present a problem for their youngest daughter Emilia, who has Down's syndrome. Emilia and her sister Maya love nothing more than playing in the garden, but currently it's unsafe and needs to be redesigned with more forgiving materials so they don't hurt themselves. Donna was born and raised in Norway, so Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam set about building a sensory, Scandi-themed garden within a 3,000 budget for the family to enjoy

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Bedford to meet single mum Katie. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they transform her lacklustre bedroom into a relaxing space that doubles as a home office. Maxine Dwyer uses her potions to treat make-up spills on the carpet

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for late spring and summer, sowing poppies and planting cornflowers for colour and interest in the Paradise Garden. Toby Buckland revels in some fabulous spring planting on a visit to the magnificent, landscaped gardens of Melbourne Hall in Derbyshire. Rachel de Thame meets a passionate dahlia grower who was once a florist working at the White House for President Obama and the First Lady

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: Slovakia, Hungary and Romania mark the halfway point in Si King and Dave Myers' baking odyssey. They begin in a cafe in Bratislava, where they are served three cakes inspired by British TV cookery shows, then taste kremesh, the Hungarian version of vanilla slice. They also try a roadside snack of deep-fried pastry with sour cream and cheese, an Eastern European take on bread-and-butter pudding, and cheese and bacon savoury scones, before ending this leg of their journey with a family party thrown by Dave's Romanian wife Lil

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Frances Tophill visits an allotment grower on the Isle of Man who uses her plants to make natural skincare products, Iolo Williams goes in search of a pair of Hen Harriers in Snowdonia, and Tom Kerridge show us how to make his special version of Eton mess

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Steve Backshall reaches the summit of a table-top mountain, after climbing a vertical cliff face nearly as high as the Empire State Building. Meanwhile, Dr George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan have to haul three boats and all their kit through the jungle after finding the rapids of the Rewa River impassable. At the end of the journey, George presents a report on the expedition to the President of Guyana, Bharrat Jagdeo

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Comedians Jamali Maddix and Bobby Mair compete in West Yorkshire, guided by experts Natasha Raskin Sharp and Angus Ashworth. Between browsing for bargains and battling for the best punchline, Angus and Bobby explore the fascinating history of the printed page around the city of Leeds, while Jamali and Natasha explore how the strange evolution of the optical toy led to the profusion of games and media encountered today. In spite of advice, one funnyman thinks a porcelain parrot will be profitable, while the other invests in a toy robot. The duo then take their purchases to auction in Bourne End, Buckinghamshire

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Caroline Hawley head to the National Maritime Museum in Falmouth, Cornwall, where they unearth items including an unusual tortoise and an electric guitar

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nina Conti, Nick Helm, Athena Kugblenu and Toby Tarrant hope they have what it takes to win the final challenges, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from the capital of the Republic of Ireland, Dublin, on the DART suburban railway to the harbour town of Dun Laoghaire. He joins the crew of the RV Malice to survey what lies beneath the waves in Dublin Bay. Back on dry land, the DART takes Michael to his next stop, Sandycove, where James Joyce, one of Ireland's greatest writers, found inspiration

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits the Norfolk village of Cley next the Sea and finds that due to Dutch settlers in the Elizabethan era, it's not as 'next the sea' as it once was. Ben talks to historian Onyeka Nubia, who reveals that the village was part of a cosmopolitan community that introduced Britain to the canary and even the beer we drink today

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter is in the 8x6 greenhouse assessing progress so far and Scott Smith replaces the ornamental arch in the picket garden with a yew tree alternative. Lizzie Schofield continues her series in which she helps a couple turn the patch of turf outside their new build into a terrific outdoor space, and Brian Cunningham has the latest from his own garden in Old Scone

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Featuring Ramona Jones, who was diagnosed with autism in her twenties and discovered how she can find her true identity when she is in the garden. Monty Don makes some changes to pots in the Jewel Garden, and also plants out squash and harvests gooseberries. Adam Frost visits an Arts and Crafts garden in North Yorkshire, and finds much to inspire and surprise. And Rekha Mistry reveals her new garden in the Peak District

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: Cameras follow teams at three of the Trust's houses in Kent, including the former family home of Winston Churchill. Looking for a rural retreat within commutable distance of Westminster, in 1922 Winston and Clementine Churchill bought Chartwell House. The house was opened to the public in 1966, shortly after Churchill's death, and today it preserves a unique record of both his public and private lives

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob venture from London Euston to the Scottish Highlands, taking a sleeper train overnight to their destination. They wake in the stunning vista of the North West Scotland, where the pine forests and snow topped mountains almost take their breath away

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Faisal Islam

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Roads Not Taken (2020)
programme.desc: Drama following a day in the life of Leo and his daughter Molly, as he floats through alternate lives he could have lived, leading Molly to wrestle with her own path as she considers her future. Directed by Sally Potter and starring Javier Bardem and Elle Fanning

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at the growth of paramilitary organisations in the early 1970s, with killings, explosions, intimidation and street disorder becoming widespread - with devastating and often lasting effects. Coercive control, intimidation, beatings and executions were part of how these groups operated in their different communities, a world in which people could be 'disappeared'', never to be found for decades afterwards

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: West Midlands Police work to identify who is responsible for a major fire that has burned a factory in Birmingham to the ground. Fire investigator Luke Beckett is deployed to open the case before vital evidence is destroyed by the blaze, but after searching the wreckage, the cause is still a mystery. With no natural sources of ignition, Luke concludes the fire was started deliberately and, in a stroke of luck, the factory's CCTV room is left intact after the fire

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: Part two of two. Charting the start of the historic wave of 2022 strikes, which saw more days lost to strike action since the Thatcher era. Mick Lynch and the RMT are at the forefront of the movement alongside nurses withdrawing their labour for the first time in the union's 106-year history

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Tag learns the importance of listening on his first day

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: King Tiger tries on lots of hats

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Carrot comes to the rescue when Evil Pea kidnaps Supertato

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer's over-officious management style becomes too much for the sheep, who decide it is time for him to chill out

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Eager to prove her babysitting ability, Gran is on the hunt for a baby stand-in

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Boy is afraid of being honest in case he hurts other people's feelings

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Mad Madeline steals the dangerous Sceptre of Queen Dorius

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Omar and Oswald search for gifts for Orla's 500th birthday

programme.title: Game on Grandparents
programme.desc: Ryan and Lisa go head to head with Amarah and Desmond as they compete for the chance to make it to the Grand Final and become ultimate Game on Grandparents champions

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: The brothers go to work at a German zoo, where Tyler discovers the wonders of the rainforest, Aaron goes ape with orang-utans, and Cam makes a splash at an elephant pool party

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Experience BMX thrills and wheelchair basketball skills as the team celebrates the Sport Badge in an outdoor special lfrom the Blue Peter garden. Mwaksy, Joel and Abby take on a wind-propelled blo-karting race that tests their speed and agility, and discover how Blue Peter fans have earned their badges

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall heads to South Africa, where he joins teams trying to prevent the rhino from being hunted into extinction

programme.title: Pooch Perfect
programme.desc: Sheridan Smith presents as four more professional dog groomers are put to the test. First up in the Breed Makeover round are four English cocker spaniels, as the contestants try to tame the gun dogs' wig and furnishings. They are then challenged to create a tricky spiral around the coats of four frizzy-haired models, before parading them on the dogwalk, where their owners see the results for the first time. Verity Hardcastle and Colin Taylor judge their efforts and decide who is going through to the next round

programme.title: Animals Behaving Badly
programme.desc: In the final episode, Liz Bonnin meets the animals going to extreme measures to survive, and reveals the some of the surprising scientific discoveries behind their ingenious behaviour. Liz examines the behaviour of cockatoos vandalising houses in Sydney, chimpanzees using bullying tactics to get to the top, crabs who hold anemones hostage to protect themselves, and the stone martens who cause millions of pounds worth of damage to cars while protecting their territories

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: The remaining families from the previous heat face a surprise challenge - shepherd's pie - as they compete for a place in the play-off. For their second task, the families make a two-course meal with smoked haddock and chocolate as the star ingredients. Presented by Tommy Banks and Angellica Bell

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by Angela Hartnett for a discussion on how to make delicious, high-quality food on a tight budget, with the chef and restaurateur pitting her vanilla custard tart against the host's beef and blue cheese risotto. Plus, Oliver Peyton discovers how to spice up his life on the cheap, Kimberley Wilson lifts the lid on how to make great grub from waste food, and drinks expert Joe Wadsack selects the best cut-price wine

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms narrates a profile of the American actress, who died in December. Debbie became a mainstay of Hollywood's so-called golden age with her appearance in Singin' in the Rain, and the programme makes use of rare archive interviews in which the star discusses her favourite film roles. Also covered is Debbie's private life, including the collapse of her marriage to Eddie Fisher, and her relationship with her daughter Carrie Fisher, who also died in December, one day before her mother

programme.title: How the West Was Won (1962)
programme.desc: Three generations of a pioneering family experience many ordeals and adventures in their endeavour to build a new life for themselves on the American frontier in the 19th century. Over the years, the family experiences the key events of the nation's history, including the gold rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads. Western, starring James Stewart, John Wayne, Gregory Peck, Henry Fonda, Debbie Reynolds, Lee J Cobb and Richard Widmark

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Nick Davies and Anita Manning value antiques at Wallasey Town Hall on the Wirral Peninsula, and Paul Martin chooses his favourite objects at Dunham Massey stately home

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: Cameras follow teams at three of the Trust's houses in Kent, including the former family home of Winston Churchill. Looking for a rural retreat within commutable distance of Westminster, in 1922 Winston and Clementine Churchill bought Chartwell House. The house was opened to the public in 1966, shortly after Churchill's death, and today it preserves a unique record of both his public and private lives

programme.title: Whisky Galore! (2016)
programme.desc: In 1943, disaster strikes on the remote Hebridean island of Todday when they run out of whisky. Salvation arrives when a ship carrying 50,000 cases of whisky founders on the island's rocks, but the locals clash with authority in the shape of Home Guard commander Captain Waggett. Comedy, starring James Cosmo, Eddie Izzard and Naomi Battrick

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Dr Johnson seeks Prince George's support in publishing his new dictionary, but brainless Baldrick burns the only copy. Edmund sets out to save the English language by rewriting the great man's masterpiece - but he has only one night to complete it. Comedy, guest starring Robbie Coltrane, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie

programme.title: Barry Manilow at the BBC
programme.desc: With a string of hits in the 1970s and '80s and a succession of hugely successful albums that he is still recording today, the American singer-songwriter has carved a unique place as both performer and songwriter. This programme features archive performances by Manilow, with songs from concerts at the Royal Albert Hall and Blenheim, as well as appearances on Top of the Pops, Strictly Come Dancing and the Proms

programme.title: One Night with Barry Manilow
programme.desc: A 2004 concert by the American singer-songwriter, featuring hits including Mandy, Copacabana, I Write the Songs and Can't Smile Without You. The programme also features contributions from his fans, who explain why his music has retained its appeal throughout the decades

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Alison Goldfrapp has a couple of tracks from her debut solo album The Love Invention, on which she channels her love for disco and house, while the Lathums perform two songs from their second LP From Nothing to a Little Bit More. Plus, performances by singer Eddie Chacon and producer John Carroll Kirby, Anglo-American duo Baba Ali and Amsterdam singer-songwriter the Jordan

programme.title: Barry Manilow at the NEC 1989
programme.desc: A concert in Birmingham by the American singer-songwriter, featuring performances of Can't Smile Without You, Mandy, Copacabana (At the Copa) and I Write the Songs

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: A 2019 concert by the American singer-songwriter in which he plays a selection of his hits accompanied by the BBC Concert Orchestra

programme.title: Glastonbury 2013
programme.desc: A selection of performances from the festival held at Worthy Farm, near Pilton in Somerset. Arctic Monkeys, the Rolling Stones and Mumford & Sons headlined the Pyramid stage, with acts including Portishead, Chic featuring Nile Rodgers, Public Enemy, Chase & Status, the xx and Bobby Womack topping the bill on other stages around the site

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Featuring Ramona Jones, who was diagnosed with autism in her twenties and discovered how she can find her true identity when she is in the garden. Monty Don makes some changes to pots in the Jewel Garden, and also plants out squash and harvests gooseberries. Adam Frost visits an Arts and Crafts garden in North Yorkshire, and finds much to inspire and surprise. And Rekha Mistry reveals her new garden in the Peak District

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter is in the 8x6 greenhouse assessing progress so far and Scott Smith replaces the ornamental arch in the picket garden with a yew tree alternative. Lizzie Schofield continues her series in which she helps a couple turn the patch of turf outside their new build into a terrific outdoor space, and Brian Cunningham has the latest from his own garden in Old Scone

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits the village of Pennan on the north coast of Aberdeenshire, which was made famous as the primary location for the film Local Hero. Rosie Morton takes part in a whale rescue exercise on the Firth of Clyde, joining volunteers to see how marine mammals entangled in fishing equipment are freed. Nick Nairn joins Dougie cook locally sourced monkfish to make fish tacos with soft flour tortillas

programme.title: The Edible Garden
programme.desc: Gardeners' World presenter Alys Fowler demonstrates how to grow salad ingredients in the garden, including tomatoes, lettuce and cucumbers, but a blight hampers proceedings. She then prepares lime-leaf salad, dandelion fritters and nettle beer

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: Tommy Banks and Angellica Bell preside as the four winning families from last week's heats return to the kitchen to compete for the remaining two places in the finals. The teams must recreate a Catalan fish stew, then are given a whole salmon and challenged to come up with a selection of dishes that will use as much of the fish as possible

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain
programme.desc: The chef continues his culinary tour in Castile - a region famous not only for its vast plains and castles but also as the home of 11th-century military leader El Cid - before heading to La Mancha, an area renowned for its rustic dishes and wine production, as well as being the land of Miguel de Cervantes' literary character Don Quixote

programme.title: Meet Me in St Louis (1944)
programme.desc: A job offer tempts a banker to consider uprooting his close-knit family and moving to New York. However, his wife and children struggle with the prospect of leaving their friends behind, and are horrified when they realise they might miss out on the 1904 St Louis World's Fair. Meanwhile, teenage daughter Esther faces the abrupt termination of her romance with the boy next door. Musical, starring Judy Garland, Tom Drake and Margaret O'Brien

programme.title: Guys and Dolls (1955)
programme.desc: A gambler accepts a bet that he cannot win the heart of a strait-laced Salvation Army member. Meanwhile, his friend has to find a secret location for an illegal dice game he is organising - while also contending with the police, a mobster and a girlfriend desperate to drag him to the altar. Musical, starring Frank Sinatra, Marlon Brando and Jean Simmons. Songs include Luck Be a Lady Tonight and Sit Down You're Rocking the Boat

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents a collection of the best finds from the show's travels round the country

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: The actor visits Milan, the capital of Lombardy, where he goes for aperitivo with a social media star and tries some of the Missoni family's favourite dishes, sampling brasato, polenta and freshly foraged mushrooms

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Giles Coren head to the Qasr Al Sarab Desert Resort in the United Arab Emirates, surrounded as far as the eye can see by vast sand dunes. Here, the pair work alongside the dedicated hotel staff and find out what it takes to create an atmosphere of palatial comfort in one of the world's most extreme and inhospitable environments

programme.title: Gods of Tennis
programme.desc: A look at the fierce rivalry between Bjorn Borg and John McEnroe, and how their sporting prowess brought with it an intense level of media scrutiny as well as celebrity and glamour to Centre Court. While McEnroe's bad-boy antics infuriates the tabloids and the Wimbledon hierarchy, it was the seemingly calm and collected Borg who struggled to cope

programme.title: The Rocky Horror Picture Show (1975)
programme.desc: A young strait-laced couple stranded by a storm take shelter in an eerie castle, where they are enticed into the weird world of a menagerie of debauched characters - presided over by a mad sex-crazed transvestite scientist - and undergo a startling transformation as they let go of their inhibitions. Cult musical, with Tim Curry, Susan Sarandon, Barry Bostwick and the show's creator Richard O'Brien

programme.title: Glastonbury 2014
programme.desc: A selection of performances from the festival at Worthy Farm in Somerset, including from the headline sets by Arcade Fire, Metallica and Kasabian. Other artists taking to the site's many stages included Blondie, Bombay Bicycle Club, Disclosure, Dolly Parton, Ed Sheeran, Elbow, Ellie Goulding, Haim, Lily Allen, Kaiser Chiefs, Kodaline, Lana Del Rey, and Robert Plant & the Sensational Shape Shifters

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from King's Lynn, Norfolk. Her panel comprises Minister in the department for Levelling-Up, Housing and Communities Lee Rowley MP, Shadow Secretary of State for Work and Pensions Jonathan Ashworth MP, broadcaster Ayesha Hazarika, who was an adviser to the Labour Party, and peer and former Supreme Court Justice Jonathan Sumption

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: Paul insists on having Kappen's body exhumed. Jackie reluctantly allows it, but warns him that a wrong step could fatally compromise the force's reputation. At a press conference discussing the exhumation, questions are raised about the line of enquiry regarding Willoughby, and why more is not being done to eliminate other suspects first. Paul nonetheless puts all his efforts into following the Kappen theory, forcing Phil and Geraint to take matters into their own hands

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Michelle Gayle presents studio performances and videos from November 17, 1994, by M People, Suede, Baby D, Blur, Urge Overkill, New Order, Sheryl Crow, Kate Bush and Pato Banton

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier introduces music by Carter the Unstoppable Sex Machine, Jimmy Nail, Louis Armstrong, New Atlantic featuring Berri, Jamiroquai, Kylie Minogue, Sinead O'Connor, Luther Vandross and Baby D from November 24, 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen host the June 7, 1984 show, featuring Spandau Ballet, Howard Jones, Evelyn Thomas, Bananarama, Bronski Beat and Wham!

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from June 8, 1978. With music by Manfred Mann's Earth Band, Lindisfarne, the Rolling Stones, Goldie, AC/DC, Boney M, Guy Marks, Maxine Nightingale and David Soul

programme.title: Queens of Soul
programme.desc: A compilation of archive footage to celebrate the critically-acclaimed female singers whose voices have come to define the soul genre, including Aretha Franklin, Roberta Flack, Gladys Knight, Randy Crawford, Angie Stone, Mary J Blige and Beyonce

programme.title: Killing Me Softly: The Roberta Flack Story
programme.desc: A documentary profile of the American singer, best known for her early 1970s hits such as The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face, Where Is the Love and Killing Me Softly with His Song. The programme documents her middle class upbringing, born out of the self-contained hub of a segregated country, and her relative late breakthrough, occurring in her mid thirties. As a solo and duet artist she had her detractors for adapting her style to white traditions, but eventually won over a nation with her soft, gentle tones. Contributors include Dionne Warwick, Johnny Mathis and Cissy Houston, as well as several reflections from Flack herself

programme.title: Aretha Franklin: Duets
programme.desc: Admirers including Elton John, Gloria Estefan, Smokey Robinson, PM Dawn, Bonnie Raitt and Rod Stewart share a stage with the Queen of Soul. The concert took place at Manhattan's Nederlander Theatre in 1993, as an AIDS benefit. Elton, Smokey and Rod provide backing vocals on the first number Chain of Fools

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: In a concert from last year's BBC Proms, Jules Buckley and his ensemble are joined by American singer and Quincy Jones protge Shela to showcase the songs made famous by the Queen of Soul. Presented by Clara Amfo from the Royal Albert Hall

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Michelle Gayle presents studio performances and videos from November 17, 1994, by M People, Suede, Baby D, Blur, Urge Overkill, New Order, Sheryl Crow, Kate Bush and Pato Banton

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier introduces music by Carter the Unstoppable Sex Machine, Jimmy Nail, Louis Armstrong, New Atlantic featuring Berri, Jamiroquai, Kylie Minogue, Sinead O'Connor, Luther Vandross and Baby D from November 24, 1994

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Part two of two. Monty explores the country during autumn, beginning at one of the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they are protected from the coming winter. Monty follows the history of the Japanese garden through the military strongholds of past leaders to the many styles, new and old, of the iconic stroll garden and finds a slice of Victorian England in the heart of Tokyo. He also learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle. He ends his journey by the Sea of Japan at a place that makes art out of its gardens

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose tells the story of Captain James Cook's historic 1768 voyage to observe the transit of Venus, while also searching for a vast southern continent. No such land mass was discovered, but the crew of the Endeavour went on to Tahiti and Australia, which Cook claimed for Britain. The ship was almost ripped apart on the Great Barrier Reef, but the captain's navigational skills eventually steered it back home to safety

programme.title: Law of Tehran
programme.desc: Crime thriller about a dedicated police officer's relentless pursuit of a drug kingpin, leading him down a dark path rife with corruption and shifting morality. Starring Payman Maadi and Navid Mohammadzadeh. In Persian

programme.title: The Best of Les Dawson
programme.desc: A tribute to the comedian featuring clips of some of his best sketches and stand-up routines. First shown in May 1997

programme.title: Talking Comedy
programme.desc: Angela Thorne narrates a look back at clips of the comedian and writer's appearances on some of the BBC's best-loved talk shows

programme.title: The Many Faces of
programme.desc: Profile of the Manchester-born comedian known for his deadpan humour and jokes at the expense of his wife and mother-in-law. The programme explores his beginnings in northern clubs and appearance on talent show Opportunity Knocks, and charts his rise to stardom. Contributors include John Cleese, Robert Webb and Russell Kane. Narrated by Sally Phillips

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose tells the story of Captain James Cook's historic 1768 voyage to observe the transit of Venus, while also searching for a vast southern continent. No such land mass was discovered, but the crew of the Endeavour went on to Tahiti and Australia, which Cook claimed for Britain. The ship was almost ripped apart on the Great Barrier Reef, but the captain's navigational skills eventually steered it back home to safety

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Part two of two. Monty explores the country during autumn, beginning at one of the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they are protected from the coming winter. Monty follows the history of the Japanese garden through the military strongholds of past leaders to the many styles, new and old, of the iconic stroll garden and finds a slice of Victorian England in the heart of Tokyo. He also learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle. He ends his journey by the Sea of Japan at a place that makes art out of its gardens

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Les Dawson hosts an EastEnders special of the comedy game show, with early stars of the soap Peter Dean, Leslie Grantham, Paul Medford, Sandy Ratcliff, Wendy Richard and Gillian Taylforth filling in the blanks in the hope of matching the contestants' answers. From November 1986

programme.title: Pop Quiz
programme.desc: Mike Read asks the questions in the 1980s quiz, with teams made up of Phil Collins, Robert Plant, Bill Bruford, Suzi Quatro, Colin Moulding and Geoff Deane. First broadcast in May 1982

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World
programme.desc: Opera singers from around the world gather at St David's Hall for the 40th anniversary of the prestigious international competition. In the opening round, singers from South Korea, Canada, England and South Africa perform with the Welsh National Opera Orchestra, hoping to win a place in Sunday's final. The judges are Brian McMaster, former director of the Edinburgh International Festival, Argentinian mezzo-soprano Bernarda Fink, Welsh soprano Rosemary Joshua, composer Errollyn Wallen and Aidan Lang, general director of Welsh National Opera. Presented by Petroc Trelawny and Josie d'Arby

programme.title: Sacred Music: The Story of Allegri's Miserere
programme.desc: Simon Russell Beale explores the 300-year history of the sacred choral work, which was decreed by the Pope to be too beautiful to be heard outside the Sistine Chapel. An English organist, a choirmaster from Worcester and the great composers Mozart and Mendelssohn all played a part in the transformation of Allegri's original 17th-century composition into the haunting music known today. Featuring a performance of the piece by award-winning choir the Sixteen, conducted by Harry Christophers

programme.title: The Borg v McEnroe Tie-Break 1980
programme.desc: The story of the famous Wimbledon final between Bjorn Borg and John McEnroe, which went to five sets including a mammoth tie-break in the fourth

programme.title: John McEnroe: Still Rockin' at 60
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents an intimate profile of the tennis champion. The programme features contributions from family and friends including his wife - new wave singer-songwriter Patty Smyth - long-time sporting rival Bjorn Borg, and Chrissie Hynde of the Pretenders, who provides an insight into McEnroe's musical passions. Sue pays a visit to McEnroe's art gallery and examines how he has continued playing until the age of 60 after his retirement from the professional circuit

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob examines the darker side of one of Britain's most original and inventive artists, as she delves deep into the history, cinema and art of America - as well as her own personal past. Parker is a sculptor working with found materials, creating beauty from acts of brutality, including an exploded shed, piles of squashed silver and the charred remnants of a burnt church. This year, she embarked on the most high-profile commission of her career, the roof of New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc: Looters made the most of an opportunity when the MSC Napoli ran aground in January 2007, spilling its cargo on Branscombe beach in Devon. However, they were reviving a tradition that stretches back centuries - connecting coastal communities around Britain to a sinister profession. Author Bella Bathurst embarks on an epic journey from the Isles of Scilly to the Orkney Islands to explore wrecking

programme.title: Brian Cox's Jute Journey
programme.desc: The Succession actor travels to Calcutta, retracing the journey of jute workers who started out in his home city of Dundee and went on to seek their fortunes in India. On the way he meets Lily Thompson, who went deaf while working in the mills, and spent years using a special sign-language to communicate with the other workers. He also meets members of the Calcutta and Moffusil Society and samples deep-fried jute

programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monsters small kite doesnt seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. Elder Panda is disappointed but he does understand, as he too wanted to fly before he could run, but sometimes you have to start small before going big.

Spy cameras also capture displays of affection among manatees and cuttlefish courtship, as well as the mimic octopus passing itself off as other creatures to avoid predators

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second show this year from the Eden Project in Cornwall, where items include fragments of hair from the poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge, a set of beads given as a gift from a Zulu king to the Royal Navy surgeon who treated him and a Greek plate dating back to 300BC. Also, Marc Smith hears the stirring story of the Second World War pilot who shot down five enemy aircraft in a single night

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Terry is forced to confide in Arty and Ron over a business venture, while Annie ignores her marital problems by accepting an invitation from Nick. Back at the hostel, Stevie convinces Pattie to spend the day with him and Kate leaves her hut behind in pursuit of a suburban address. With everyone preoccupied, Peter gets forgotten

programme.title: Steeltown Murders: Hunting a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.title: Rush (2013)
programme.desc: The 1976 Formula One Championship season is dominated by a fierce rivalry between two contrasting racers, as daredevil British driver James Hunt and methodical Austrian defending champion Niki Lauda put their lives on the line to outdo each other on the track. Fact-based drama, starring Chris Hemsworth, Daniel Bruhl and Olivia Wilde

Martel Maxwell is in Hartlepool to see a three-bed mid-terrace with a very low auction guide price

programme.title: Father Brown

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Having spent 30 years living and working in Hong Kong, a would-be buyer teams up with presenter Jonnie Irwin, seeking a property in North Yorkshire on a budget of 350,000. programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Runcorn, Cheshire, where they meet two Craigs. Each has different ideas about what they want from their bland back garden. One wants a stylish, contemporary space with clean lines and the other wishes to fill the garden with wildlife. Lee and Chris set about creating the perfect garden that pleases both on a 5,000 budget

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Croydon, south London, to help new parents Adam and Jen with their unfinished nursery. After discovering they were expecting twins, DIY took a back seat, leaving the couple with no storage for their baby kit. The team has just 24 hours and a limited budget to make Adam and Jen's home child friendly

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Northern Ireland gymnast Rhys McClenaghan has won medals at all of the major international competitions. This documentary follows him as he takes part in 2022's three biggest events - the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham, the European Championships in Munich and the Gymnastics World Championships in Liverpool. In what was the toughest year of the 23-year-old's career so far, it offers an insight into his relentless training schedule and hears about the personal and physical sacrifices that come with being an elite athlete

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits the village of Pennan on the north coast of Aberdeenshire, which was made famous as the primary location for the film Local Hero. Rosie Morton takes part in a whale rescue exercise on the Firth of Clyde, joining volunteers to see how marine mammals entangled in fishing equipment are freed. Nick Nairn joins Dougie cook locally sourced monkfish to make fish tacos with soft flour tortillas

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Olympic modern pentathlon gold medal winner Joe Choong, ex-England rugby League player Jon Wilkin, snowboarder Aimee Fuller and former world squash number one Nick Matthew join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Harry Hill hosts as comedian Jack Dee and journalist Zing Tsjeng join team captain Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of recent headline stories

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: In a bid to acquire help Dom and Kay meet up with Kirsty, who divulges some classified information - if only to stop Dom shouting at her running club - but crucially tells them she cannot help. Back on the estate, the pair are forced to deal with the consequences of their drug-dealing activities - at which point Dom receives a call from Celia Herrington, offering them freedom from the gang in return for the dossier. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie are joined by actors, TV presenters and showbiz brothers Adam and Ryan Thomas. Plus, Alex Jones reads out some terrifying audience confessions in Please Keep Me Anonymous and there's another It Goes Or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one just refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: A new relationship threatens to upend the Chalmers-Davises, Jacinda navigates a complex friendship and Vince struggles to ask for what he needs. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Rosa's boys resist their new stepfather, while Oly and Santi find a new connection and Dom thinks about next steps. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: The Exorcist (1973)
programme.desc: A girl is possessed by a formidable demonic entity that resists all efforts at freeing her from its grasp. In desperation, the child's mother appeals for help from a local priest and a veteran exorcist, but succeeding in this nightmarish contest of wills threatens the lives of both men. William Friedkin's horror, starring Linda Blair, Jason Miller, Ellen Burstyn, Max von Sydow and Lee J Cobb

programme.title: Nadiya Bakes
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain shares her love of baking with some of her favourite recipes, from every day treats to indulgent desserts. programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages three items from a recycling centre in Witley, then she and two experts transform a dressing table, a vintage suitcase and a petite sofa

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers bid against each other to buy a toy rocket and rabbit, a gramophone, lamp shades, a high chair and a brooch

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: The beautiful Wye Valley may not be too far from Bristol, where today's couple are from, but it's a whole world away in terms of lifestyle. Steve Brown has some tempting properties up his sleeve and during some downtime all three manage to unwind and enjoy the scenery with a leisurely canoe ride on the River Wye itself

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Ben and Ruth call on the services of Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill to redesign their garden in Stockport, Greater Manchester, into something more chic. At present it's a bit dated with too much concrete - and too many level changes for it to be safe for their baby daughter Eve. The couple are imagining a wild, natural garden with prairie style planting and some opportunities for growing their own vegetables. They have a budget of 2,500 available to realise their dreams

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes host a celebrity special of the music quiz, which sees Oti Mabuse and Catherine Tyldesley, Joe Marler and Maisie Adam, and Chris McCausland and John Thomson trying to guess the songs from their intros. Which pair will make it through to the final and get the chance to win up to 10,000 for their chosen charity?

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night gameshow, in which contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. In each episode, contestants are guided by a host of celebrity experts, with tonight's advice coming from Ed Balls, Clara Amfo, Ally McCoist, Sindhu Vee, Dan Walker, Stacey Dooley and John Whaite

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the quiz show. Catherine Bohart, Charlie Higson, Lindsey Russell, Neil Jones, Kellie Shirley, Danny John-Jules, Sukh Ojla and Vikki Stone try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max takes Jodie to task for turning up to work with a hangover. When he realises that it is the anniversary of her mother's death, he tries to make amends for making a traumatic day even worse. Gethin rejects Jan's offers of help, and Jacob has arranged to see a therapist but cannot bring himself to go through with it

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: The team are called in when writer Cara Gibson is found dead under a bridge. Her books ruined careers and left a lot of lives in tatters, but could any of her subjects be driven to murder? Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple returning from living in Sweden for 25 years who want to find a home in Wiltshire, and goes for a ride with a professional carriage driver

programme.title: Paddington 2 (2017)
programme.desc: The lovable little bear has settled into his new life with the Brown family in London, becoming a much-loved member of the local community - until his search for a birthday present for his aunt leads to him being framed as a thief. While the Browns try to clear Paddington's name, he tries to make himself at home in prison, winning over the other convicts and getting involved in an escape attempt. Comedy adventure, starring Hugh Bonneville, Hugh Grant and Sally Hawkins, with Ben Whishaw providing the voice of Paddington

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin visits the Argyll Coast and Islands, which was designated Hope Spot status in 2019 because it is home to the only nursery in the world for the endangered flapper skate. He joins marine biologist Chris Rickard as he conducts research into these mysterious creatures of the deep. Adam Henson looks at the robots and artificial intelligence being developed that promise to revolutionise UK agriculture. And John Craven launches this year's photo competition in aid of Children in Need

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture displays of emotion from sea creatures, including dolphins getting an adrenaline rush from jumping, leaping and playing tricks in the waves. programme.title: Feed Yourself Fitter with Stephen Nolan
programme.desc: Cold water swimmer Mary has no problem braving the icy waters of Lough Neagh every Sunday. How she looks doesn't bother her in the slightest, but what her extra weight is doing to her health very much does. Having piled on the pounds year on year for over two decades she is suffering more and more from increasing aches and pains. Mary is the heaviest she has ever been and she knows it's not good for her. Sympathetic to her plight, Stephen joins her in the kitchen as she samples healthy foods including scallops for the first time, courtesy of chef Michael Deane

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Patrick Bradley meets a couple from the seaside village of Donaghadee who plan on transforming a disused High Street bank dating back 100 years into a modern home. Spanning three floors, the renovation will be no easy task and neither will deciding what to do with the original walk in safe. Patrick investigates the history of the building and researches the evolution of banking over the last 100 years

programme.title: Paddington 2 (2017)
programme.desc: The lovable little bear has settled into his new life with the Brown family in London, becoming a much-loved member of the local community - until his search for a birthday present for his aunt leads to him being framed as a thief. While the Browns try to clear Paddington's name, he tries to make himself at home in prison, winning over the other convicts and getting involved in an escape attempt. Comedy adventure, starring Hugh Bonneville, Hugh Grant and Sally Hawkins, with Ben Whishaw providing the voice of Paddington

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin visits the Argyll Coast and Islands, which was designated Hope Spot status in 2019 because it is home to the only nursery in the world for the endangered flapper skate. He joins marine biologist Chris Rickard as he conducts research into these mysterious creatures of the deep. Adam Henson looks at the robots and artificial intelligence being developed that promise to revolutionise UK agriculture. And John Craven launches this year's photo competition in aid of Children in Need

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture displays of emotion from sea creatures, including dolphins getting an adrenaline rush from jumping, leaping and playing tricks in the waves. Spy cameras also capture displays of affection among manatees and cuttlefish courtship, as well as the mimic octopus passing itself off as other creatures to avoid predators

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second show this year from the Eden Project in Cornwall, where items include fragments of hair from the poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge, a set of beads given as a gift from a Zulu king to the Royal Navy surgeon who treated him and a Greek plate dating back to 300BC. Also, Marc Smith hears the stirring story of the Second World War pilot who shot down five enemy aircraft in a single night

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Terry is forced to confide in Arty and Ron over a business venture, while Annie ignores her marital problems by accepting an invitation from Nick. Back at the hostel, Stevie convinces Pattie to spend the day with him and Kate leaves her hut behind in pursuit of a suburban address. With everyone preoccupied, Peter gets forgotten

programme.desc: The 1976 Formula One Championship season is dominated by a fierce rivalry between two contrasting racers, as daredevil British driver James Hunt and methodical Austrian defending champion Niki Lauda put their lives on the line to outdo each other on the track. Fact-based drama, starring Chris Hemsworth, Daniel Bruhl and Olivia Wilde

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James looks forward to this year's Soccer Aid with comedian and actor Sanjeev Bhaskar and serves up recipes to enjoy during the big match with a little help from chefs Paul Ainsworth, Tommy Banks and John Hooker

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner have crowd-pleasing dishes to bring the family together, beginning with a breakfast treat of salted caramel monkey bread. John then makes roast pork with fennel and apples to be served with Lisa's pimped-up mash, and there is a desset of a rhubarb and berry plate pie to finish

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Oli Bell presents coverage of five races from Haydock Park, including the John O'Gaunt Stakes and Pinnacle Stakes, plus three races from Beverley. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Megan Nicholls, reports by Matt Chapman and Adele Mulrennan, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Celebrity Lingo
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by RuPaul in which famous faces pair up and try to use their powers of deduction to fill in the blanks and find the missing words in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The celebrity teams will be playing for big money for their chosen charities up against the clock and their opponent, with the pairings for the first show being Joel and Hannah Dommett, Alan Halsall and Andy Whyment, and Andi Peters and Laura Tobin

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites McFly's Danny Jones, Made in Chelsea star Georgia 'Toff' Toffolo and Coronation Street's Lisa George to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, answering questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Plymouth for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.
